data.event: Glasgow was laid out and platted in 1836, partially from land acquired from former Missouri State Treasurer James Earickson It was named for James Glasgow, a local merchant.
The Battle of Glasgow was fought on October 15, 1864, in and near Glasgow as part of Price's Missouri Expedition during the American Civil War.

event.title: was ultimately defeated at Westport a week later

data.event: Although the battle resulted in a Confederate victory and the capture of significant war material, it had little long-term benefit as Price was ultimately defeated at Westport a week later, bringing his campaign in Missouri to an end.

event.title: January 20, 1891, an African American man, Olli Truxton, was killed

data.event: On January 20, 1891, an African American man, Olli Truxton, was killed by a white lynch mob in Glasgow.
